text: Huron Consulting Group is a consulting
and professional services business,

and our clients range from
education, life sciences,
healthcare, as well as business advisory.

We had a large presence
in a physical data center,

and we were sort of looking at
our holistic vision for
what the next five years, what the next
10 years might look like.
The pathway for our company

and our strategy has been
for a long time to be
as cloud native as possible.

We began all of our net new
development on AWS a number

of years ago, and in parallel
we migrated our legacy VMs
up to VMware Cloud on AWS.
And step two was
to migrate from VMC on AWS over
to native services such as EC2
or replatforming, or

rebuilding our application
entirely into Lambda API
gateway, more serverless technologies.
The tool set that really allowed us

to be successful in our
migration was the AWS Application
Migration Service.

We were able to leverage
many of the automations

and orchestrations that
exist within the service

to really move our workloads
with minimal interruption

and extraordinarily quickly.
AWS was able to meet us
where we were, meet us in the middle,
and meet us where we wanted to end up
and guide us the entire way.
